page.title: 14RELIGIOUS LIFE OF BLURTON
page.content: There are four churches in our area which are the Church of the Good Shepherd, which is Roman Catholic, St. Bartholomews and St. Albans, which are Church of England, and the Methodist church. St. Bartholomews is the oldest out of the four churches and the Good Shepherd and the Methodist churches are both 21 years old. The churches are there to serve the community. The Church of the Good Shepherd has the largest congregation of 300 people per mass. The Methodist church has 25 members and 15 or 16 people at services. At St. Bartholomews the average attendance is 150 and the age range of the congregation goes from 2 years old to 80 plus. At the church of the Good Shepherd and the Methodist churches the average age is 50 plus.
